item.title: The potential marketing opportunities presented by a customizable wearable device
item.description:
Source: Broadcast Wear website. Control the shirt’s display with an app. Broadcast Wear, an innovative company from Hyderabad, has introduced a programmable t-shirt with touch-sensitive technology, opening up exciting possibilities for marketing. Their invention incorporates a flexible, washable LED screen directly into the fabric. Users can pair the shirt with the Broadcast Wear smartphone app to instantly show any text or image. A simple tap turns the screen on and another tap switches it off...

item.title: Smartfren Android users will receive a smart start screen from Celltick
item.description:
Source: Android Play Store. The MySmartfren app. Celltick, a company that provides mobile marketing solutions, has teamed up with Indonesian telecommunications company Smartfren Telekom (Smartfren) to introduce a smart home screen for Android users. Smartfren aims to give its 12 million subscribers quick access to their most-used apps and features, along with special deals. This will be achieved through a personalized version of Celltick’s “Start” app, pre-installed on Smartfren Android devices...

item.title: Mobile app-driven ATMs without screens could be the future of banking
item.description:
EyeLock, a company that provides iris-based identity authentication solutions, has partnered with Diebold, a global provider of self-service technology, to create a screenless, compact ATM concept. A prototype called Irving is currently being tested by Citibank in the US. This innovative ATM design eliminates the need for a PIN pad, card reader, or screen. Instead, users conduct transactions through a mobile app on their smartphone. The system utilizes near field communication (NFC), quick response (QR) code technology, and EyeLock’s iris scanning to verify the customer’s identity at the ATM...
